So yes, I am an hourly employee. This means I have to fill out a time card and log my working hours every week. I have to accumulate PTO, since only salaried get unlimited PTO. Plus, I have to use my PTO for non-holidays during the company shutdown periods (for example, company shutdown in July is July 5-9, but only July 5 and 6 are classified as paid holidays, so I have to use PTO for July 7-9). This basically means I have no PTO for vacations outside of company shutdowns for the first year at Adobe.I expect to be promoted to SWE II within a year, but after that, I think my career growth at Adobe may be limited or slower than I would like. My team doesn't really work on mission-critical stuff, which is why it's so chill and deadlines aren't really strict, but that also means promotions may be slower. Also, my team is very small, and in fact I am the only junior SWE on the team.
